availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, iron manufacturer and farmer. Kentucky native. Born April 30th 1810, Married Elizabeth L. Martin, August 24th, 1836. Father to S.M.G Jackson, George M. Jackson, Elizabeth G. Jackson, Mary S. Jackson, Sarah S. Jackson, Josiah Jackson, and Frank Jackson. Iron Manufacturer in Estill County in 1850. Co-owner, with J.W. Jones of the Estill Steam or Red River Steam Cold Blast Furnace is Estill County. Farmer in Estill County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in 1860. Died October 29th, 1862. Buried in Winchester Cemetery, Winchester, Clark County Kentucky.
